lorem_bootsum.0: Build responsive, mobile-first projects on the web with the world's most popular front-end component library.
lorem_bootsum.1: Bootstrap is an open source toolkit for developing with HTML, CSS, and JS. Quickly prototype your ideas or build your entire app with our Sass variables and mixins, responsive grid system, extensive prebuilt components, and powerful plugins built on jQuery.
lorem_bootsum.2: Looking to quickly add Bootstrap to your project?
lorem_bootsum.3: Use the Bootstrap CDN, provided for free by the folks at MaxCDN.
lorem_bootsum.4: Using a package manager or need to download the source files?
lorem_bootsum.5: In need of a button, but not the hefty background colors they bring?
lorem_bootsum.6: Many of our components require the use of JavaScript to function.
lorem_bootsum.7: Specifically, they require jQuery, Popper.js, and our own JavaScript plugins.
lorem_bootsum.8: Buttons will appear pressed (with a darker background, darker border, and inset shadow) when active.
lorem_bootsum.9: jQuery must come first, then Popper.js, and then our JavaScript plugins.
lorem_bootsum.10: Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.
lorem_bootsum.11: Alerts are available for any length of text, as well as an optional dismiss button.
lorem_bootsum.12: Using color to add meaning only provides a visual indication, which will not be conveyed to users of assistive technologies – such as screen readers.
lorem_bootsum.13: Alerts can also contain additional HTML elements like headings, paragraphs and dividers.

lorem_bootsum.17: Badges can be used as part of links or buttons to provide a counter.

lorem_bootsum.19: Indicate the current page's location within a navigational hierarchy that automatically adds separators via CSS.
lorem_bootsum.20: Group a series of buttons together on a single line with the button group, and super-power them with JavaScript.
lorem_bootsum.21: In order for assistive technologies (such as screen readers) to convey that a series of buttons is grouped, an appropriate role attribute needs to be provided.
lorem_bootsum.22: Combine sets of button groups into button toolbars for more complex components.
lorem_bootsum.23: Feel free to mix input groups with button groups in your toolbars.
lorem_bootsum.24: Components and options for laying out your Bootstrap project, including wrapping containers, a powerful grid system, a flexible media object, and responsive utility classes.
lorem_bootsum.25: Containers are the most basic layout element in Bootstrap and are required when using our default grid system.
lorem_bootsum.26: While containers can be nested, most layouts do not require a nested container.
lorem_bootsum.27: Bootstrap primarily uses the following media query ranges—or breakpoints—in our source Sass files for our layout, grid system, and components.
lorem_bootsum.28: Since Bootstrap is developed to be mobile first, we use a handful of media queries to create sensible breakpoints for our layouts and interfaces.
lorem_bootsum.29: Bootstrap’s grid system uses a series of containers, rows, and columns to layout and align content.
lorem_bootsum.30: Use our powerful mobile-first flexbox grid to build layouts of all shapes and sizes thanks to a twelve column system, five default responsive tiers, Sass variables and mixins, and dozens of predefined classes.
lorem_bootsum.31: Bring Bootstrap to life with our optional JavaScript plugins built on jQuery.
lorem_bootsum.32: Nearly all Bootstrap plugins can be enabled and configured through HTML alone with data attributes (our preferred way of using JavaScript functionality).
lorem_bootsum.33: To disable the data attribute API, unbind all events on the document namespaced with data-api like so.
lorem_bootsum.34: Bootstrap provides custom events for most plugins’ unique actions.
lorem_bootsum.35: All public APIs are single, chainable methods, and return the collection acted upon.
lorem_bootsum.36: In these circumstances, namespace collisions can occasionally occur.
lorem_bootsum.37: Dropdowns are toggleable, contextual overlays for displaying lists of links and more.
lorem_bootsum.38: Bootstrap’s dropdowns, on the other hand, are designed to be generic and applicable to a variety of situations and markup structures.
lorem_bootsum.39: Bootstrap’s form controls expand on our Rebooted form styles with classes.
lorem_bootsum.40: Use these classes to opt into their customized displays for a more consistent rendering across browsers and devices.
lorem_bootsum.41: Checkboxes are for selecting one or several options in a list, while radios are for selecting one option from many.
lorem_bootsum.42: Use these for form layouts that require multiple columns, varied widths, and additional alignment options.
lorem_bootsum.43: Easily extend form controls by adding text, buttons, or button groups on either side of textual inputs.
lorem_bootsum.44: Place one add-on or button on either side of an input.
lorem_bootsum.45: Place any checkbox or radio option within an input group’s addon instead of text.
lorem_bootsum.46: A lightweight, flexible component that can optionally extend the entire viewport to showcase key marketing messages on your site.
lorem_bootsum.47: The most basic list group is an unordered list with list items and the proper classes.
lorem_bootsum.48: Use Bootstrap's JavaScript modal plugin to add dialogs to your site for lightboxes, user notifications, or completely custom content.
lorem_bootsum.49: Before getting started with Bootstrap’s modal component, be sure to read the following as our menu options have recently changed.
lorem_bootsum.50: Modals are built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
lorem_bootsum.51: Clicking on the modal 'backdrop' will automatically close the modal.
lorem_bootsum.52: Whenever possible, place your modal HTML in a top-level position to avoid potential interference from other elements.

lorem_bootsum.55: Change the horizontal alignment of your nav with flexbox utilities.
lorem_bootsum.56: By default, navs are left-aligned, but you can easily change them to center or right aligned.
lorem_bootsum.57: In the example below, our nav will be stacked on the lowest breakpoint, then adapt to a horizontal layout that fills the available width starting from the small breakpoint.

lorem_bootsum.63: Pagination is built with list HTML elements so screen readers can announce the number of available links.

lorem_bootsum.65: When triggered from anchors that wrap across multiple lines, popovers will be centered between the anchors’ overall width.
lorem_bootsum.66: Popovers must be hidden before their corresponding elements have been removed from the DOM.

lorem_bootsum.68: Include multiple progress bars in a progress component if you need.
lorem_bootsum.69: Tooltips are opt-in for performance reasons, so you must initialize them yourself.
lorem_bootsum.70: Triggering tooltips on hidden elements will not work.
lorem_bootsum.71: The tooltip plugin generates content and markup on demand, and by default places tooltips after their trigger element.
lorem_bootsum.72: The required markup for a tooltip is only a data attribute and title on the HTML element you wish to have a tooltip.
